channel.title: RSPS Status Checker
channel.description:
Hello. I created this tool for MoparScape Users so im giving it now when its complete :)
It is a simple up/down checker. If you dont know how to use it click on the " Help " button :)
Screenshot: http://gyazo.com/39c3aab6cf4c64ce09b7e5935b52c135
Download: http://dl.dropbox.com/u/65743038/Server%20Status%20Checker.exe
A weird AV will detect this as PUA.WinPacker32 or something but its not virus. You can use a .Net reflector to check the source :)
Sorry added link :P

item.title: RSPS Status Checker
item.dc:creator: @T41 t4
item.description:
@T41 wrote:

[quote=“thanks u, post:6, topic:444585”][quote author=Onix link=topic=547272.msg4012288#msg4012288 date=1339320438]
I’ve already released one here, but thanks for the release I guess.

Just be wary when downloading if there is a virus detected. Anything like this shouldn’t include a ‘WinPacker32’

I also don’t like the fact you have to write the port - 1 to check the port. You could compensate for this so they could just write 43594 instead of 43595 to check port 43594.

This also doesn’t check if the server is online or not, it only checks if they have opened the specified port, not if the server is open. You would have to send a packet to the server and wait for a response, not just check the port.
[/quote]

It is a Server Status Checker because it pings the Host that the server is hosting on to check if the port is open. The port wont be open if nothing is running in that port.[/quote]
that doesn’t work…

Read full topic

item.title: RSPS Status Checker
item.dc:creator: @thanks_u thanks u
item.description:
@thanks_u wrote:

[quote=“Onix, post:7, topic:444585”][quote author=thanks u link=topic=547272.msg4013208#msg4013208 date=1339400785]

I’ve already released one here, but thanks for the release I guess.

Just be wary when downloading if there is a virus detected. Anything like this shouldn’t include a ‘WinPacker32’

I also don’t like the fact you have to write the port - 1 to check the port. You could compensate for this so they could just write 43594 instead of 43595 to check port 43594.

This also doesn’t check if the server is online or not, it only checks if they have opened the specified port, not if the server is open. You would have to send a packet to the server and wait for a response, not just check the port.

It is a Server Status Checker because it pings the Host that the server is hosting on to check if the port is open. The port wont be open if nothing is running in that port.
[/quote]But that doesn’t explain why it comes up with a virus, does it?[/quote]
It does not come up as a virus. It comes up as a WinPacker. I have no idea why. If you want i could post a vid of me building the program and then virus check it.
And if it was real virus all AV’s would detect it now because i have already submitted it to VirusTotal.

Read full topic

Just be wary when downloading if there is a virus detected. Anything like this shouldn’t include a ‘WinPacker32’

I also don’t like the fact you have to write the port - 1 to check the port. You could compensate for this so they could just write 43594 instead of 43595 to check port 43594.

This also doesn’t check if the server is online or not, it only checks if they have opened the specified port, not if the server is open. You would have to send a packet to the server and wait for a response, not just check the port.
[/quote]

It is a Server Status Checker because it pings the Host that the server is hosting on to check if the port is open. The port wont be open if nothing is running in that port.[/quote]But that doesn’t explain why it comes up with a virus, does it?

Read full topic

item.title: RSPS Status Checker
item.dc:creator: @thanks_u thanks u
item.description:
@thanks_u wrote:

[quote=“Onix, post:2, topic:444585”]I’ve already released one here, but thanks for the release I guess.

Just be wary when downloading if there is a virus detected. Anything like this shouldn’t include a ‘WinPacker32’

I also don’t like the fact you have to write the port - 1 to check the port. You could compensate for this so they could just write 43594 instead of 43595 to check port 43594.

This also doesn’t check if the server is online or not, it only checks if they have opened the specified port, not if the server is open. You would have to send a packet to the server and wait for a response, not just check the port.[/quote]

It is a Server Status Checker because it pings the Host that the server is hosting on to check if the port is open. The port wont be open if nothing is running in that port.

item.title: RSPS Status Checker
item.dc:creator: @Bellend Bellend
item.description:
@Bellend wrote:

People think about it… its working because we dont use applications to see if a server is online, we use them to see if we have opened the port, if you want to check to see if the server is online, use php and echo the status on your site…

Read full topic

item.description:
@Onix wrote:

I’ve already released one here, but thanks for the release I guess.

Just be wary when downloading if there is a virus detected. Anything like this shouldn’t include a ‘WinPacker32’

I also don’t like the fact you have to write the port - 1 to check the port. You could compensate for this so they could just write 43594 instead of 43595 to check port 43594.

This also doesn’t check if the server is online or not, it only checks if they have opened the specified port, not if the server is open. You would have to send a packet to the server and wait for a response, not just check the port.
